uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms

Interface Form

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Contexed, java.lang.Iterable<Field>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseForm, BaseHTMLForm, CommandLineForm, HTMLForm, MapForm, PageHTMLForm

    public interface Form
extends java.lang.Iterable<Field>, Contexed
    Interface for building and querying Forms. A Form is functionally an ordered set of Fields. Once built a Form can be used as a Map between field names and values. The methods used to actually edit a form are specific to the implementing class.

    A Form may either be used as just a collection of fields with associated validation ie as a component of a larger composite form or may contain a set of FormAction classes to define an action to take on form submission.

        java.util.Set<FormValidator> getValidators()

      • validate

        boolean validate()
        validate a form. This method checks the fields and the installed FormValidator if any. No details of the exact error are returned by this call.
        Returns:
        boolean true if valid

      • poll

        default boolean poll()
              throws TransitionException
        Attempt to show/validate the current state of the form as part of a multi-phase form. This is called during form construction when values from inputs are needed to construct the rest of the form. If the method returns true then form construction can continue. For GUI forms this may mean that a partial form has been shown and completed by the end user. If false then the method will have modified the form to add actions to progress the multi-stage completion and the form should be displayed as-is.

        If multi-stage submission is not supported the method will just return true.

        Returns:
        boolean true if form build should continue
        Throws:
        TransitionException

      • supportsMultiStage

        default boolean supportsMultiStage()
